title: Diploma in Strategic Performance Management
headline: Strategic Performance Management plays a pivotal role in any organization’s human resource framework.
description: This free online Strategic Performance Management course starts with performance management as it plays a pivotal role in any organization’s human resource framework. There are clear benefits from managing individual and team performance to achieve organizational objectives. Performance management strategy aims to provide the means through which better results can be obtained from the organization standards and competence requirements etc.

courseDescription:
This free online Diploma in Strategic Performance Management course starts with performance management as important because it plays a pivotal role in any organization’s human resource framework. There are clear benefits from managing individual and team performance to achieve organizational objectives. A well-designed performance management process stimulates managers to develop high-quality strategic plans, set ambitious targets, and track performance closely-all activities which help to achieve strategic objectives and consequently sustained value creation.

Performance management strategy aims to provide the means through which better results can be obtained from the organization, teams and individuals by understanding and managing performance within an agreed framework of planned goals, standards and competence requirements. The course is designed to help students and HR professionals to understand the nuances of performance management system as it is a continuously evolving process, which consists of defining, planning, analyzing and developing performance. It focuses on commitment and support building as also recognizing and rewarding performance and contribution.

The course discusses a number of approaches to measure and methods of reviewing and analyzing performance to facilitate improved among managers. An effective performance
management system brings helps in clarifying our roles and performance expectations by focusing on performance

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Performance Management and its Role in Employee Development
modules.description: In this module you will learn about Performance Management and its Role in Employee Development. We will discuss certain understanding issues, meanings, and definitions related to performance and performance management.
topics: Performance Management and its Role in Employee Development - Learning Outcomes
Aim and purpose of Performance Management
Characteristics of an Effective Performance Management System
Role of PM in Employee Development and Identification of Key Performance Areas
Performance Management and its Role in Employee Development - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about Performance and Strategic Planning. Learn also how to plan the performance and solve the issues related to performance planning and how strategic planning is linked with the performance.
topics: Performance and Strategic Planning - Learning Outcomes
Performance and Strategic Planning - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about Performance Measurement. Learn also about performance dimensions and the various dimensions that we need to measure. They are two types of measurement system; subjective which is used for measuring behavior, and the other one is objective which is used for measuring results.
topics: Behavior, Result and Trait Approach System

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about Implementing Performance Management System and how we can effectively implement a performance management system in the organization.
topics: Implementing Performance Management System - Learning Outcomes
Implementing Performance Management System - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Strategic Performance Management - First Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.
topics: Diploma in Strategic Performance Management - First Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Performance Management Skills and Increasing Self Awareness
modules.description: In this module you will learn about Performance Management Skills and Increasing Self Awareness and how performance management could be linked with or is going to see that employee development happens.
topics: Performance Management Skills and Increasing Self Awareness - Learning Outcomes
Coaching Skills for Managers and Evaluation
Performance Management Skills and Increasing Self Awareness - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about Performance Review and Analysis. Performance review is the process of evaluating the quality of employees work and discussing your assessment which is conducted annually with follow ups.
topics: Performance Review and Analysis - Learning Outcomes
Use of Performance Management Data for HR Decision Making
Performance Review and Analysis - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about Potential Appraisal and Reward System and how potential appraisal can be used to identify leaders for the future. Learn also how to link performance management with the reward system.
topics: Potential Appraisal and Reward System - Learning Outcomes
Potential Appraisal and Reward System - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Performance Management Systems in Indian Organisations
modules.description: In this module you will learn about Performance Management Systems in Indian Organisations. Learn also the role of culture in an organisation and how most of the organizations in India have realised the importance of performance management system. Along with learning about structural changes in the performance management system of the organisation.
topics: Performance Management Systems in Indian Organisations - Learning Outcomes
Performance Management System in Indian Organisations
Performance Management System in Select Indian Companies
Performance Management Systems in Indian Organisations - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Diploma in Strategic Performance Management - Second Assessment
modules.description: You must score 80% or more to pass this assessment.
topics: Diploma in Strategic Performance Management - Second Assessment

modules.name: Module
topics: Diploma in Strategic Performance Management Final Assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Identify and manage your performance effectively and contribute to organizational performance to enable organizations achieve their goals and objectives.
    • Discuss the aim and purpose of the performance management system.
    • Discuss the characteristics of an effective performance management system.
    • Outline various ways to manage the performance of the individual group or the organization.
    • Identify how performance management can be used for the growth and development of employees.
  • Understanding Performance Management

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Understanding Performance Management

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The Performance Management Contribution

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • The Performance Management Contribution

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Characteristics of an Effective PM System (Part 1)

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Characteristics of an Effective PM System (Part 1)

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Performance Management Process & Examples (Part 1)

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Performance Management Process & Examples (Part 1)

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Employee Development Plan, Objectives & Examples

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Employee Development Plan, Objectives & Examples

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Performance is a function of ability, effort, motivation, and organizational support. Performance is defined as the output delivered using certain inputs. It is achieved by an individual, group, or department of an organization, concerning a given role.
    • Performance management systems provide a clear guideline about the standards, the time frame, the criteria against which people are evaluated. Performance management systems give an idea of what needs to be done with the subordinates so that they can perform well.
    • This evaluation or measurement of the performance is also linked with reward, helping in certain administrative decisions to promote or to reward employees.
    • A performance management system not only specifies an individual performance to be achieved by the
      individual but also specifies how individuals and groups are going to contribute to that organizational goal.
    • A sound performance management system helps to re-create goals at different levels.
    • The PM system should be congruent with the individual, group/unit, and organisation's strategy.
    • Context congruence is required to ensure that system is aligned with the goals and objectives of the organization.
    • Two important prerequisites that are required before a PM system is implemented: knowledge of the organization's mission and strategic goals- a result of strategic planning and knowledge of the job in question

  • Lesson Summary

    • This evaluation or measurement of the performance is also linked with reward, helping in certain administrative decisions to promote or to reward employees.
    • A performance management system not only specifies an individual performance to be achieved by the
      individual but also specifies how individuals and groups are going to contribute to that organizational goal.
    • A sound performance management system helps to re-create goals at different levels.
    • The PM system should be congruent with the individual, group/unit, and organisation's strategy.

    • Two important prerequisites that are required before a PM system is implemented: knowledge of the organization's mission and strategic goals- a result of strategic planning and knowledge of the job in question

  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Discuss how to plan the performance and solve the issues related to performance planning.
    • Identify how to link strategic planning with performance.
    • Outline  your vision and mission statement.
    • Identify issues related to goals and strategies.
    • Describe how strategy and performance can be aligned.
  • Understanding Performance Planning

  • Strategy and Performance Alignment (Part 1)

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Strategy and Performance Alignment (Part 1)

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Performance planning is the first step of performance management.
    • To determine what and how a job is to be done so that both the employee and his superior understand each other expectations. It flows from organizational or unit objectives and is undertaken jointly by the employee and his superior.
    • The development of a performance plan happens at the beginning of the performance cycle or on commencement in a new job role.
    • An Initial Performance Plan is a detailed plan for either an individual or a team.
    • Strategic planning involves describing the organization's destination, assessing barriers that stand in the way of that destination, and selecting approaches foe moving forward.
    • Opportunities in the environment can help the organization to succeed such as markets not currently being served, untapped labor pools, and new technological advances.
    • Threat prevent organizations from being successful such as economic recession to the innovative products of competitors.
    • Mission statements provide information on the purpose of the organization and its scope.
    • Vision statements are typically written after the mission statement is completed because the organization needs to know what it is and what its purpose is.
  • Lesson Summary
    • Performance planning is the first step of performance management.
    • To determine what and how a job is to be done so that both the employee and his superior understand each other expectations. It flows from organizational or unit objectives and is undertaken jointly by the employee and his superior.
    • The development of a performance plan happens at the beginning of the performance cycle or on commencement in a new job role.

  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Identify the various dimensions which we can use for measuring performance.
    • Discuss three different approaches to performance.
    • Outline the various ways to measure behavior and results.
    • Explain comparative and absolute systems.
    • Examine how to collect data related to performance using different approaches.
  • Performance (Determinants & Factors)

  • Components & Characteristics of an Appraisal Form

  • Components & Characteristics of an Appraisal Form

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Performance is about behavior or what employees do, not about what employees produce or the outcomes of their work.
    • Behavior is also a part of the performance because behavior cannot be segregated from the result, as we cannot expect results. Behavior could be multidimensional.
    • Behavior helps to achieve the goal and also contributes to the organizational goal. However, if the behavior is not multidimensional, then probably it is not going to help to perform well.
    • Two types of behaviors; task and contextual performance.
    • Each employee gets evaluated on certain skills and dimensions related to the behavior like acting with integrity, focusing on the customers, delivering results, building a relationship, and demonstrating leadership.
    • In the evaluation or the development process, you look for desired behavior.
    • Tasks included in the job description can be grouped into clusters of tasks based on their degree of relatedness. Each of these dusters or accountabilities is a broad area of the job for which the employee is responsible for producing results.
    • Two types of competencies; Differentiating competencies and threshold competencies.
    • Competencies are measured using data provided by individuals who make a judgment regarding the presence of the competency.
  • Lesson Summary
    • Performance is about behavior or what employees do, not about what employees produce or the outcomes of their work.
    • Behavior is also a part of the performance because behavior cannot be segregated from the result, as we cannot expect results. Behavior could be multidimensional.
    • Behavior helps to achieve the goal and also contributes to the organizational goal. However, if the behavior is not multidimensional, then probably it is not going to help to perform well.
    • Two types of behaviors; task and contextual performance.
    • Each employee gets evaluated on certain skills and dimensions related to the behavior like acting with integrity, focusing on the customers, delivering results, building a relationship, and demonstrating leadership.
    • In the evaluation or the development process, you look for desired behavior.
    • Tasks included in the job description can be grouped into clusters of tasks based on their degree of relatedness. Each of these dusters or accountabilities is a broad area of the job for which the employee is responsible for producing results.
    • Two types of competencies; Differentiating competencies and threshold competencies.
    • Competencies are measured using data provided by individuals who make a judgment regarding the presence of the competency.
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Discuss how to develop a performance management system and ways of implementing it.
    • Identify how we can effectively implement a performance management system in the organization.
    • Outline the objective of self-appraisal.
    • Identify how to manage team performance.
    • Describe 360 degree appraisal.
  • Implementing PMS and Communication Plan

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Self Appraisal (Purpose, Process & Steps)

  • Performance Management and Teams

  • 360 Degree Appraisal & what it Measures

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • 360 Degree Appraisal & what it Measures

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • 360 Degree Appraisal & what it Measures

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Appeal process supports that PMS can be gained by ImplemenUig an appeals process, increases perception of the system's fairness, and promote employees buy-in to PM system in an Amicable/Non-retallatory way.
    • Behavioral Observation Training is implemented to minimize unintentional rating errors, focuses on how raters observe, store, recall, and use information, involves showwg raters in use of observational aids such as notes or diaries.
    • Benefits of behavioural observation training; records a pre-established number of behaviors on each performance dimension, increase the sample of incidents observed and recorded during a specific time period, aid such as a diary is an effective way to standardize the observation of behavior, acts as a record of critical incidents throughout the review period, and serves as a memory a*d to fill out evaluation forms.
    • Self-appraisal provides an opportunity for the employee to recapitulate activities, achievements and failures, strengths and weaknesses; initiates an organization-wide process of annual review.
    • Self-appraisal should start at the end of the performance period.
    • Challenges faced by performance management; assessing relative individual contribution, balancing individual and team performance, identifying individual and team measures of performance.
    • 360 degree measures; measures behaviors and competencies, addresses skills such as listening, planning, and goal-setting, focuses on subjective areas such as teamwork, character, and leadership effectiveness.
